Dear Ms. Zambiasi:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
December 1, 2023. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter
and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the corrective action
plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be completed
or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at 616-552-3662.
Sincerely,
Deborah Will, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
Rule 400.4123 Education
• (2) Provision shall be made for an appropriate
education program in accordance with 1976 PA
451, MCL 380.1 to 380.1853. Each resident of
school age shall be enrolled not later than 5
school days after admission and continuously
thereafter.
One of three youth was not enrolled in school within 5 days of admission with no
reason documented.
Rule 400.4155 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; initial treatment plan
• (1) The social service worker shall complete,
sign, and date an initial treatment plan for each
resident within 30 calendar days of admission.
Two of two ITPs were not completed within 30 days. One plan due on 11/16/23
was not completed as of 12/1/23, and another plan was completed 30 days late.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Rule 155 (1) and 156 (1) - Treatment Plan authors must ensure timeframes for
ITPs are no longer than 30 days and UTPs are no longer than 90 days.
Timeframes for plans need not overlap. For example, if the end date on the
previous plan is 1/31/24, the next plan should start on 2/1/24.
• Rule 123 (2) - If due to extenuating circumstances, a youth cannot be enrolled in
school within 5 days, the reason should be documented and placed in the
education section of the youth's file.
3

V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• In October 2023, I discovered the type of clientele had recently changed in Deroy
and Myriam Halls and that a bolt lock was placed on the exit door of Myriam Hall. I
asked the facility to immediately remove the bolt lock and requested a new Fire
Inspection. Two Fire Inspections were completed. The first received a D rating
and the follow up inspection received an A rating qualifying Myriam as a secure
building on 12/21/23. Consultation was provided related to the change in acuity of
the youth in buildings under the Vista Maria Open Residential license. Myriam
Hall transitioned from non-secure to secure and a new application was received
identifying Myriam Hall as such.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period. However, there was one confirmed case related to SIR 2023C0000510.
The staff involved was placed on administrative leave on 7/10/23 and officially
terminated on 9/5/23.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 5 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
Five CAPs submitted. All goals were met on two. Three CAPs are still being
monitored for implementation.
Financial Overview
No financial concerns were identified.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
Five CAPs were submitted for the period under review. Two were completed and
three are pending completion.
4

Staff and Youth Interviews
One staff person shared that the type of clientele accepted into Deroy and Myriam
Halls recently changed from stepdown/transitional living to mental health. As a
result, I requested a revised program statement and provided other assistance and
consultation.
Youth reported no concerns.
Description of Agency Walk Through
Youths relaxing after school. Staff were stationed in general area and hallway to
rooms. Three residents are brand new, and all were recently directly released from
psychiatric hospitals. Observed general living spaces and rooms which were neat
and clean. Supply closet locked.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
